questions: Write the following sets by listing method and also write the numbers of elements of these sets: A = {prime numbers up to 13}
Tick (√) if the following sets are empty and cross (×) if they are others than empty: The set of natural numbers less than 1
Separate the finite and infinite set from the following sets: A = {odd numbers greater than 20}
State which of the following sets are equal: P = {prime numbers from 2 to 9}, Q = {odd numbers from 1 to 8}
Separate the equivalent set from the following sets: A = {g, o, d}, B = {d, o, t}
If A = {0, 1, 2, 3}, B = {1, 2, 3}, C = {0}, D = {}, E = {1, 2, 3} and F = {1}, write the number of elements of each set.
Are the sets A = {4, 5} and B = {c, d} equivalent? Write with reason.
If U = {natural numbers less than 25} is a universal set then write the following sets by listing method: A = {square numbers less than 25}
Write an appropriate universal set for the following sets: A = {2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14} and B = {1, 3, 5, 7, 9}
If a set F = {Marigold, Rose, Rhododendron}, make the subsets taking only one element from set F and name them.
Separate the proper subset and the improper subset from the subsets formed.
Among the sets A = {1, 2, 3, 4}, B = {2, 3, 4} and C = {4, 3, 2, 1}, which is the proper subset of A?
Make all the possible subsets from the set A = {a, b, c}.
Write down all possible subsets that can be formed from the set P = {a, b}.
If set A = {factors of 6} and B = {prime numbers less than 10}, write the set A and set B by listing method and set-builder method.
If the set L = {natural numbers from 1 to 10 exactly divisible by 2}, M = {multiples of 2 upto 10} and N = {natural numbers from 12 to 16}, which sets are equal and equivalent?
If the set A = {even numbers greater than 10} and B = {even numbers less than 10}, what are the set A and set B finite or infinite? Why?

Is there any greatest whole number?
Write the successor and predecessor of 99.
Find the product of the greatest number of three digits and the smallest number of one digit.
Find the difference of the greatest and the smallest numbers formed by the digits 9, 4, 0, 7, 3.

Find the HCF of 21 and 28 by prime factorization method.
Find the HCF of 144 and 312 by division method.

Find the least number which is exactly divisible by 42, 49 and 63.
Find the least number from which when 10 is subtracted, the difference will be exactly divisible by 15, 22, 45.

Write the absolute value of −15 and +15.

Subtract −13 from 8.
Find the product of −7 and −9.
Divide −56 by 8.

The product of two integers is −72. If one integer is 9, find the other integer.
State the additive inverse of −11.
Which is greater: −5 or −8?
Arrange in ascending order: −3, 0, −7, 5, −1.
Write the opposite integer of (+3).
Find the sum by using number lines: (+3) + (+4).
Subtract by using number lines: (−8) − (−3).
Find the sum from both ways using the commutative law of the integers: (+3) and (+6).
Find the sum from both ways using the associative law of the integers: (+2), (−3) and (−5).
What is the sum of (+9) and its opposite integer?

Multiply by using number line: (−4) × 3.

Find the quotient: (+36) ÷ (+6).

In a quiz contest, rules are made to provide (+10) for each correct answer and (−5) for each incorrect answer. If the Blue House scored 60 marks, in which 2 questions were answered incorrectly, how many questions were answered correctly?
Write the additive inverse of 2/5.
Write the multiplicative inverse of 3/4.
Convert the following fraction into decimals and separate terminating and non-terminating recurring decimal numbers: 1/2.
Convert 0.5̄ into fraction.
Convert 0.41̄ into fraction.
Write any two rational numbers lying between 1/2 and 3/4.

Are all the whole numbers rational numbers?
Are all the integers rational numbers?
Is zero (0) a rational number?
Are all the rational numbers integers?
Subtract 6(1/8) − 8 from 30 and add 1(1/4).
Sandeep's monthly income is Rs 27,000. He has spent 1/5 part of his income on food. If 1/10 part spent on clothing and 2/5 part spent on transportation, how many parts did he spend in total?
Out of 40 students in a class, 1/5 students like English subject. 2/5 students like mathematics. Find the number of students who like English.

Ranju's father gave her Rs 60,000. She bought books for one-third of her money. She bought clothes with one-fourth of the rupees. One-fifth of the rupees is spent on her travel. How much did she spend?
Ritu ate 3/5 parts of an apple and the rest was eaten by his brother, Suman. Write in fraction the part of the apple that Suman ate.
Prakriti has spent 1/4 parts of the money. She has lost 2/5 parts from the remaining amount. If the lost money is Rs. 900, find out how much money he had at the beginning.
Area of the triangle = 1/2 × base × height. If the base of a triangle is 25.75 cm and the height is 30.15 cm then find the area.
The length of a rectangular garden is 22.66 cm, and breadth is 15.65 cm. What is the area of the garden?
The perimeter of a squared table is 24.4 ft. Find the length of the table.
The area of a rectangular field is 215.66 m². If the field is 67.35 m long, find out how wide it is.
Write the ratio of 10 cm and 100 cm and convert it to the lowest term.
Find the ratio of the distance AB : AG from a number line.
Find the ratio of the shaded part to non-shaded part from a given figure.
There are 450 students in a school, among them 180 are girls. Find the ratio of girls and total students.
There are 25 teachers and 500 students in a school. Find the ratio of teachers and students.
The height of Pramesh is 165 cm and the height of Pramila is 150 cm. Find the ratio of the height of Pramesh and Pramila.

Find out how much money will Alisa and Dipesh get while dividing Rs 60,000 in the ratio of 5:4.
Which of the following ratios are equal: 2/3 and 4/5?
Check whether the numbers 2, 3, 12, 20 are in proportion or not.
Write extremes and means separately from the proportions: 40 : 200 :: 15 : 75.

If the price of 6 kg oranges is Rs. 540, then find out the price of 8 kg oranges.
What is the profit or loss and their percentage when CP = Rs. 300 and SP = Rs. 350?
Ajaya bought a television for Rs 30,500 and sold it for Rs 29,000. Find out what his loss percentage is.
Find out what is the cost price of a sari if it is sold for Rs. 30,500 by gaining 10% profit.
What will be the selling price of a mobile bought at Rs. 30,000 by gaining 10% profit?
A fruit seller bought 10 kg oranges at the rate of Rs. 55 per kg. If he sold all the oranges at the rate of Rs. 60 per kg, what would be the profit percentage?
Sukman bought 50 bulbs at the rate of Rs 40 to each bulb. When he opened the packet of bulbs, 15 bulbs were broken. What would be the profit or loss? Find it in percentage.
When a book was sold to a bookseller for Rs. 575, the profit was 15%. How much money was paid for the book?
Rajendra bought a refrigerator for Rs 32,500. He spent Rs. 500 to bring the goods. Find out the profit percentage if he sold the refrigerator for Rs 33,500.
Aaitman bought the old house for Rs. 95,00,000. He spent Rs. 200,000 for house repairing. If the house was sold for Rs. 1,10,00,000, what would be the profit or loss, find in percentage.
If the costs of 5 kg sugar is Rs. 450, then what is the cost of 3 kg sugar?
A motorcycle can travel 320 kilometers with 8 liters of petrol. How many liters of petrol is required to travel 50 kilometers?
If 15 people take 16 days to dig a field, how many days will it take for 8 people to dig the same field?
30 men can plant the crops in 17 days. If Amar wants to complete the same work in 10 days, how many workers will be needed?
If a machine of the industry can fill 6600 bottles of beverages in 3 hours, how many bottles can it fill in 8 hours?
Rama buys 3 kg lentil and 2 kg sugar for Rs 540. If the cost of 1 kg sugar is Rs. 90, what is the cost of 1 kg lentil?
If a cyclist can travel the distance of 15 kilometers per hour, how many meters per minute would his speed be?
In a camp, 50 people have enough food for 54 days. How many days will the food last for 60 people?
Find the perimeter of a triangle with sides 12 cm, 5 cm and 13 cm.
When Ram makes a paper triangle with the length of 40 cm around it, find the length of the third side if the two sides are 14 cm and 16 cm respectively.
